title: England boss Gareth Southgate demands instant response after Czech Republic comeback victory
text:
Gareth Southgate ordered England to muster an immediate response after admitting his side were dealt a deserved reality check in Prague last night.

The England boss wants his team to bounce back in Monday’s qualifier against Bulgaria after squandering the opportunity to qualify for Euro 2020 with a sluggish performance in the loss to the Czech Republic, despite taking an early lead courtesy of Harry Kane’s penalty.

England hadn't lost a qualifier since their defeat to Ukraine in 2009 while last night’s loss was their first pre-tournament group defeat since losing to Croatia in 2007 - the night former manager Steve McClaren was dubbed ‘wally with a brolly’.

Gareth Southgate ordered England to muster an immediate response after defeat in Prague

Southgate’s England have received plenty of plaudits during his reign - but last night the boss admitted: 'In terms of a wake up call we have had a lot of plaudits but there is a lot of work to be done to be a really top team – tonight was clear evidence of that.

‘Clearly that is not a night we wanted to be a part of. We did not play well enough, we conceded possession too cheaply, we did not create chances, we did not take good chances and we were too open out of possession, we gave the ball away,’ said Southgate.

‘We have to respond in the right way, we have a couple of days to prepare and we have to reward our supporters with a better performance. There were not many positives. We accept defeat, and accept we have to be better than we were. We weren’t good enough.

The Three Lions took the lead but fell victim to a comeback defeat by the hosts

‘It is going to be an interesting couple of days because we have not had a result like that or a performance like that and we will learn a lot about ourselves over the next 48 to 72 hours.

‘We have to respond in the right way.’

Southgate’s ploy to play full debutant Mason Mount in the No 10 role appeared to backfire as England were over-run in midfield.

There were also question marks over Southgate’s team-selection - and the England manager didn’t shy away from those doubts saying: ‘I always have to accept responsibility.

‘That is the situation we are in but we collectively have to accept the result but as manager I have to accept it.

Southgate wants to hear no excuses and accepts his side were not good enough

‘This is football – all the players in their careers, and for us as coaching staff, football is all about responding to setbacks. We have not had many so it feels more unpleasant and it is a while since we felt this way. That is the reality.’

Captain Harry Kane insisted England must remain calm despite the loss but admitted the defeat underlines they are far from the finished product.

’We’ll regroup, there’s no need to panic,’ said the striker.

‘I think it was down to us (the defeat). We went ahead early and after that were sloppy with the ball.

‘We weren’t fighting and pressing as much as normally do. Unfortunately we gave one away at the end. Every away game in Europe is difficult.

‘That’s no excuse, we have to do better than tonight. We’ve still got stuff to work on, and we can see that tonight.’
description: SAMI MOKBEL AT THE SINOBO STADIUM: Gareth Southgate ordered England to muster an immediate response after admitting his side were dealt a deserved reality check in Prague last night.
